Fall back to default Please set the correct path in the preferences and ensure it exists or is createable Success Error Backing up… Backup complete Error on backup Restoring… Restore complete Error on restore Operation complete Complete with errors Uninstall complete Error on uninstall Errors occurred Custom list App cannot be restored from a backup without APK Share Deleting backups… Delete backups
Backups deleted: No backups to delete Enable app
Enable app for users Disable app Disable app for users App data has not been restored. Preferences User preferences Service preferences Advanced preferences Tools Theme Light Dark After Backup Before Backup System\'s theme Dynamic theme (if available) Language System default Backup folder Loading toasts Show toasts while the list is being loaded Device lock Secure the app with device credentials Biometric lock Secure the app with the device\'s biometric lock (e.g. fingerprint, face unlock) Remember sort and filter Saves the chosen sorting and filtering method. Only those marked by a checkbox in the menu are considered. Filter backups by age Filter backups older than value in days. Used with the filter \'Show old backups\'. Encryption Enable to encrypt data backups Encryption password Set to empty to disable encryption Encryption password confirmation The passwords match The passwords don\'t match Enable special backups Still needs intensive testing, try knowing the danger that it can cause boot loops. Feedback is always welcome. Exclude app\'s cache Exclude app\'s cache from data backup Back up external data Backs up and restores data that is placed on the external storage (e.g. /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/) Back up obb files Backs up and restores the app\'s obb files that is placed on the external storage (e.g. /storage/emulated/0/Android/obb/) Back up media files Backs up and restores the app\'s media files that is placed on the external storage (e.g. /storage/emulated/0/Android/media/) Use session installer Use session installer instead of the basic installer. Slower but avoids issues with Android 13+ The installer package name: Restore permissions Restore permissions that were granted to the app at the moment of the backup. Note that some permissions can\'t be granted programmatically and so cause the package restore to fail as a whole, which Neo Backup then covers restoring the package without permissions. Back up device-protected data Backs up and restores data that is placed in data/user_de Number of backup revisions The oldest revision will be deleted upon creation of a new backup if the number is exceeded. Set it to zero to keep all revisions. Revision cleanup time Configures if the oldest revision is deleted before or after creating a new backup to free the disk space used by the backup. Compression Level A lower value compresses faster but results in larger files. A higher value compresses better but takes more time. Prevent sleep Acquire a wakelock during batch operations to prevent sleep. Speeds up backups and restorations considerably, but consumes more energy. Disable "Verify apps over USB" Disables this developer option while restoring APKs and re-enables it afterwards. Solves the error: INSTALL_FAILED_VERIFICATION_FAILURE. Give the restored app all the permissions it asks for. Restore with all permissions Allow restoring an older version of the installed app. Allow downgrading STOP-CONT pre- and postprocessing of apps on backup/restore Experts only: This can help, if the app is changing files during backup and the backup fails. Delete backups\? Delete backups of all apps not currently installed. Copy own APK Place a copy of Neo Backup in the top level of the backup folder Save apps list Writes apps list to a txt file in the user\'s backup directory View the log Unset
showInfoLogBar show the info log in top bar usePackageCache cache Packages usePackageCacheOnUpdate use cached Package in updateDataOf useColumnNameSAF eventually disable this, if you have problems with SAF storage cancelOnStart cancel all remaining jobs on OAndBackupX start [needs reboot] useAlarmClock use the alarm clock to schedule backups, this shows an alarm icon in the notification bar [needs reboot] useExactAlarm if not using useAlarmClock, then use exact alarms, otherwise use inexact alarms which may be better for battery [needs reboot] pauseApps pause apps during backups and restores to avoid inconsistent backups caused by ongoing file changes or other conflicts pmSuspend additionally use pm suspend command to pause apps backupTarCmd use tar shell command for backup restoreTarCmd use tar shell command for restore strictHardLinks for API tar only: unpack hard links as hard links (otherwise they become symlinks) restoreAvoidTemporaryCopy for API tar only: avoid using a temporary directory to extract files shadowRootFile use superuser file system access instead of SAF if the real file system can be found allowShadowingDefault the default for StorageFile creation (enable for now, if you want to use root shadow at all) useFindLs use \'find \.\.\. | xargs \.\.\. ls \.\.\.\' for recursive FileInfo collection assembleFileListOneStep (tarapi) collect whole tree in one step catchUncaughtException unexpected exceptions are caught and output to logcat and app is restarted [needs reboot] maxCrashLines maximum number of lines to be saved from the logcat on an uncaughtException invalidateSelective only invalidate cache for specific package cacheUris cache StorageFile per URI cacheFileLists cache file lists per directory maxRetriesPerPackage maximum number of retires per Package per Batch delayBeforeRefreshAppInfo [seconds] delay between pm install and refreshing AppInfo refreshAppInfoTimeout [seconds] maximum time to retry on refreshing AppInfo after pm install useForeground use foreground notifications to ensure app keeps running (if wakelock isn\'t enough) useExpedited use work manager forground to overcome 10 minute job timeouts useWorkManagerForSingleBackup use work manager for single backup from app sheet useWorkManagerForSingleRestore use work manager for single restore from app sheet (note this is for test only, for now it doesn't restore the selected backup but the newest) fakeBackupSeconds [seconds] time for faked backups, 0 = do not fake>Exit code: 0 Time: 0.110

Battery Optimization Backups could stop sometimes. To prevent this, you should turn off the battery optimization This device doesn\'t support ignoring battery optimizations unfortunately! Error while unzipping the data, check the encryption password! Split APKs: Backup Filters: SMS/MMS Permissions This is essential to be able to backup/restore your SMS/MMS. Call Logs Permissions This is essential to be able to backup/restore your Call Logs. Contacts Permissions This is essential to be able to match a contact to a SMS/MMS. Grant Usage Access This is essential to get the information about sizes of app\'s files App Size: Data Size: Cache Size: Logfile saved at %s License Our Group on Telegram Our Group on Matrix Frequently Asked Questions Legend: * App type\'s icon would be gray if the app is uninstalled and dark gray if the app is disabled. Data Encryption It\'s not safe to keep your data on your device not encrypted. For the safety of your data enable encryption and set a password. Sort & Filter Storage Access Welcome to Neo Backup! Neo Backup (formerly OAndBackupX) is a fork of the famous OAndBackup with the aim to bring OAndBackup to 202X and part of Neo Applications suite. For now the app is already fully rewritten, coming up would be making it robust and adding some lengthily planned features which could ease the backup/restore workflow with any device. \n Therefore all types of contribution are always welcome. \n \n Now on functionality of our App: \n • It requires root and allows you to backup individual apps and their data. \n • Both backup and restore of individual programs one at a time and batch backup and restore of multiple programs are supported. \n • Restoring system apps should be possible without requiring a reboot afterwards. \n • Backups can be scheduled with no limit on the number of individual schedules and there is the possibility of creating custom lists from the list of installed apps. The app uses read/write permission of storage to be able to access the external storage and provide the possibility for the backup of external data/obb of other apps. The app needs a backup location to store the backups. The app may need a few gigabytes of storage for a full backup and is querying the filesystem a lot. Please keep that in mind when choosing network based storage locations. The app needs this permission to be able to backup/restore your SMS/MMS. The app needs this permission to be able to backup/restore your Call Logs. The app needs this permission to be able to match a contact to a SMS/MMS. The app needs this permission to be able to check the stats and sizes of data and cache of your apps. The app can face some problems doing scheduled backups on some ROMs that adopt an aggressive battery optimizations e.g. MIUI, but even on vanilla AOSP such a problem can happen. The selected app(s) will be given the stop signal, and continue after the task is done. Check on your processed apps afterwards (and avoid launching them while the process is still running). Delete all backups There\'s nothing to show! Fetching apps list for the %1$s… Known issues Launchable Apps Updated Backups Apps Help Main Usage Notes Clear cache Exodus report Launch app App-info Are you sure you want to force kill the app\? PLACE HOLDER Copied app\'s APK to the backup directory Failed to copy app\'s APK to the backup directory Apps\' list is still not fetched. Wait… Filtered list Wrote filtered apps list file Wrote all apps list file Export/import schedules Exports or imports the list of schedules you\'ve created. No SAF manager There\'s no file manager to manage SAF. Maybe you\'ve disabled the built-in file manager. Please restore it or reenable it. Couldn\'t initiate the shell handler. Either missing toybox/busybox or disabled root permission for the app. Running schedule failed Export Import The app\'s data has been actively changed while doing the backup. Try killing its process before doing backup Schedules were exported sucessfully Schedule imported successfully Log file not found Ascending-Descending Force kill Add to the global blocklist Don\'t pick the main storage directory or Downloads folder, create a folder only for your backups. More on this in the FAQ Backup all updated apps Red Comet Fine Purple Calm Indigo Turquoise Bold Green Chartreuse Lime Thunder Yellow Apricot Orange Pumpkin Perano Arctic Cyan Ocean Teal Limette Tiger Amber Lava Orange Flamingo Pink Slate Azure Blue Mint Accent color Secondary color The encryption password is either not set or wrong! Because applications are isolated from each other, superuser access is mandatory to be able to backup and restore their data. See FAQ! Add new tag Edit note
